analysis_finding_match_results.jira_analysis_finding:
Please close the ticket. The system is working as specified because the closure is more than 700 km away and will probably have expired by the time the driver reach it, see comments of the supplier below:

"[Query Reason]: Behavior as specified (not a bug)
stefanos.athanasopoulos@tomtom.com 06.12.2024
The closure that the driver saw on the application by scrolling the navigation, will have expired by the time we reach it. Therefore that is why, the system does not report that there is a closure, nor a different route is suggested. The closure according to the data we see, is gone completely by 12:00. We would reach the closure at 19:00 since we are 736km away from the incident. For more information please see the comments."]

This is not a bug. Route is planned from an offroad location. In offroad location, we suppress guidance and voice instructions. HMI should show offroad state in the NIP and there will be no voice guidance announcements until the car moves to an onroad location.

why the voice announcement is provided that the route contains delays after every deviation from the initial route. Seems to be working as specified but it is annoying. Is there a possibility to use another trigger?
Please check at positioning why the route stucks. The trace shows an error about an incomplete positioning update.

as we dont expect such scenarios to happen frequently i would shift it to CL8 and like to understand which logic is implemented on tomtom side to trigger new alternatives after reaching waypoints/stopovers to prevent such a wrong routing.

[Title]
 3 Locations CoA announced to early to MP 

"[Short title] 3 Locations CoA is announced to early to maneuver

[Precondition]
- Internet connection by ConMod 
- HCP3 is on
- map is visible

[Action]
- follow the active route guidance
- check the timing/ distance to the maneuver point when call of action ""e.g. turn right"" is announced

[Observed]
- the timing/ distance is too early/ longer to the maneuver point 
- locaiton 1 time stamp 09:53
- locaiton 2 time stamp 10:09
- locaiton 3 time stamp 14:28

[Expected]
- CoA announced distance to the maneuver point shall be dynamically adapted with consideration of current car speed as defined in the spec. 
-  page 7 on defined spec  
https://devstack.vwgroup.com/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=2311611915#NAV_GUIDANCE_VOICE_TIMINGS(InCodebeamer)-VG-contentandtimingingenerall
- At locaiton 2 time stamp 10:09 we expect additional info by saying side road in the phrase "turn slightly right at the second"

[Healing]
 - none

[Attachments]
- media from snapshot
- log_2024-08-08_time_0953_traces.7z.esotrace

**Expectation:**

**Healing:**

ttdrivetesting

Audio warning for roadworks, but event seems too far away to already give an audio warning.

System ONLINE, traffic information available.

Current location: latitude=51.39555380553316, longitude=5.471668634705033, heading=48.600006103515625

Route planned to Venlo.

Follow the route.

Warning for roadsworks is given very early.

Warnings should be given when vehicle is <40s driving ahead of event. There was still 1km to go until event, which means we should have driven 90km/h on average to make it within 40 seconds which is far above the legal speed limit in this urban area.

[HEALING]
N/A

Traces show warning was for TrafficEvent 2171779961.

roadworkswarningtooearly.esotrace

[Title]
 Now take the exit is not necessary 

[Short title] 0.2mile for 2 maneuver points. "Now keep left then take the exit" announcement happened and after that "Now take the exit" which is not necessary.

[Precondition]
- Internet connection by ConMod 
- HCP3 is on
- map is visible

[Action]
- follow the route RG
- after exit from HOV lane there is a bifurcation and CCP shall be kept on left road and after 0,2 mile CCP shall take the exit 

[Observed]
- at the bifuration as the 1st MP, navi says "now keep left then take the exit". 
- after the bifuration, navi says "Now take the exit" at the 2nd MP.

[Expected]
- if a sequentioal maneuver announcement was given at the 1st MP, then CoA at the 2nd mp shall not be provided.
-Because distance to 2nd MP is too short
- Because CoA distance implemented in CL6 is too far away and i may take to the right at the 1st mp.

[Healing]
 - none"

- Please find traces at a link: https://etf.esolutions.de/user/?etf_id=5815876

### Issue Description
**Title:** Now take the exit is not necessary

**Precondition:**
- Internet connection by ConMod 
- HCP3 is on
- map is visible

**Observation:**
- At the bifurcation, the navigation says "now keep left then take the exit". After the bifurcation, it says "Now take the exit".

**Expectation:**
- If a sequential maneuver announcement was given at the 1st MP (Maneuver Panel), then CoA at the 2nd MP shall not be provided because the distance to the 2nd MP is too short and the CoA distance implemented in CL6 is too far away.

**Healing:** 
- none

### Issue Description
**Title:** TomTom 9 Locations CoA too early on rural road

**Precondition:**
- Internet connection by ConMod 
- HCP3 is on
- map is visible

**Observation:**
- The timing/distance is too early/long (e.g. 100m) to the maneuver point.  
- 6 locations time stamp 10:34, 10:35, 10:42, 10:44, 10:46, 10:48     

**Expectation:**
- Because we do not know how fast the user drives/legal allowed driving speed in the country car is sold, using fixed 100m is not acceptable.
- Depends on the current car speed, CoA distance to the maneuver point shall be dynamically adapted so that the user will get CoA with the same timing to the maneuver. 

**Healing:** 
- none

[Title]
Manöveranzeige wird nicht angezeigt 

VR28.11.01 Manöveranzeige wird nicht angezeigt

Vorbedingungen:
Klemme 15 an
Fahrstufe D
Fahrzeug fährt
FID & CID & PID aktiv
Zielführung aktiv

Beanstandung:
Während der Fahrt mit aktiver Zielführung wurde alles Ordnungsgemäß im FID & CID & PID angezeigt.
Nach dem man eine Alternativroute ausgewählt wurde verschwand die Manöveranzeige im FID und im CID und PID  wurde diese durch einen schwarzen Balken ersetzt.
Sobald man auf den schwarzen Balken geklickt hat kam eine unplausible Durchsage das man 18KM den Straßenverlauf folgen soll.
(Siehe Video)

Heilung: Von selbst nach ca. 5 Minuten

Reproduzierbarkeit:  manchmal / sporadisch
_________________________________________________________
VR28.11.01 Maneuver Indicator Not Displayed
Preconditions:

Terminal 15 on
Gear D
Vehicle drives
FID & CID & PID active
Destination guidance active
Complaint:
While driving with active guidance, everything was properly displayed in the FID & CID & PID.
After selecting an alternative route, the maneuver display disappeared in the FID and in the CID and PID it was replaced by a black bar.
As soon as you clicked on the black bar, an implausible announcement came that you should follow the road for 18KM.
(See video)
Healing: By itself after about 5 minutes
Reproducibility: sometimes / sporadically
_________________________________________________________

description_match_results.processed_description:
### Issue Description
**Title:** Manöveranzeige wird nicht angezeigt

**Precondition:**
- Klemme 15 an
- Fahrstufe D
- Fahrzeug fährt
- FID ("Fahrer" Information Display (behind the wheel)) & CID (Central Information Display) & PID (Passenger Information Display (on the right)) aktiv
- Zielführung aktiv

**Observation:**
Während der Fahrt mit aktiver Zielführung wurde alles Ordnungsgemäß im FID & CID & PID angezeigt. Nach dem man eine Alternativroute ausgewählt wurde, verschwand die Manöveranzeige im FID und im CID und PID wurde diese durch einen schwarzen Balken ersetzt. Sobald man auf den schwarzen Balken klickte, kam eine unplausible Durchsage, dass man 18KM den Straßenverlauf folgen soll.

**Expectation:** 
N/A

**Healing:** 
Von selbst nach ca. 5 Minuten

**Reproducibility:** 
manchmal / sporadisch

analyze needed why lane widget was not shown.

description_match_results.description:
[Title]
Back online causes route update w/DRG=semi 

[CONFIGURATION]
ttdrivetesting

Audi e-tron 55 Technology Carrier - IN-MC-431E
VR: VR 35
Gateway SW (HCP5): HW: X14 SW: D260
ConMod SW: HW: C2.3 SW: X658
Head Unit SW: VR40_A13E_HCP3_AU_MRM_20240925_01_S651
VIN: BAUNEEGFZ21052708
Navigation APK:  TT_fastfeedback_SDK_2024.41.1-dev
Resource Provider APK: built-in from platform
NAV DB: CariadMap_EUR_0200_23122_PR047.0, OTA enabled

[SUMMARY]
Automatic route update with DRG=semi when switching from offline to online.

[PRECONDITION]
Time: 14:41 CEST
Driving on A2 near Ittervoort. Current location: 51.16733411537928, 5.877255269606253

System OFFLINE (Privacy Vehicle Switch OFF)
DRG = semi-dynamic
SoC very low ~4-5%

Route to Paris, on which we have skipped CS a few times. We have gotten some EVTP Popups for unreachable destination (which is OK), but ignored them so EVTP planner is still active. Currently the route has a CS that has 0% SoC upon arrival. See 1447_onboardLDEV_deviateUntilZeroArrivalSocAtCS.png:

[ACTION]
Turn Privacy Vehicle Switch to ON to go back to online state.

[OBSERVATION]
Since we are now online, we get a BRP immediately that shows a pop-up for a route that is reachable but with +1h37min travel time, including a 22kW charger. This is OK. But while inspection the route itself, the alternative route screen appeared showing the reachable alternative and the original route. At some point, the original route vanished and the alternative route moved to the top of the list. When closing the screen, it looked like the new route had been activated automatically.

See video: 1448_DRGoff_RouteUpdatedAutomatically.mp4

[EXPECTATION]
With DRG = semi-dynamic, we do not expect the route to get updated automatically.

[HEALING]
We end up with a route that has a reachable charge station, so in terms of reachability this is not a bad outcome per se, but the 'manual selection' aspect of the semi-dynamic DRG setting was violated.

[ATTACHMENTS]
Full logs here: https://etf.esolutions.de/user/?etf_id=5978401
Cut traces:
automaticRouteUpdateDRGsemi.esotrace

[CONTACT]
pepijn.michels@tomtom.com
frank.spierings@tomtom.com
description_match_results.processed_description:
### Issue Description
**Title:** Back online causes route update w/DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance)=semi  

**Precondition:**  
- Time: 14:41 CEST  
- Driving on A2 near Ittervoort. Current location: 51.16733411537928, 5.877255269606253  
- System OFFLINE (Privacy Vehicle Switch OFF)  
- DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance) = semi-dynamic  
- SoC very low ~4-5%  
- Route to Paris, with skipped CS (Charging Station) and EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) popups for unreachable destination.  

**Observation:**  
Upon going online, a BRP (Better Route Proposal) appeared showing a reachable route with +1h37min travel time, including a 22kW charger. The original route vanished and the alternative route moved to the top of the list, leading to the new route being activated automatically.  

**Expectation:**  
With DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance) = semi-dynamic, we do not expect the route to get updated automatically.  

**Healing:**  
The outcome resulted in a route with a reachable charging station, but the 'manual selection' aspect of the semi-dynamic DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance) setting was violated.

analysis_finding_match_results.jira_analysis_finding: In any case, this is most likely a duplicate of https://tomtom.atlassian.net/browse/NAV-131736 , https://tomtom.atlassian.net/browse/NAV-128367 , https://tomtom.atlassian.net/browse/NAV-147765 , where the destination characteristics are not passed on to the instruction engine. Without this, we cannot select the best toward information from the signpost. Please add logs with the route in question (ideally only with that route).
Please check why there is no warning that the route has changed, thanks.
Please check at positioning why the route stucks. The trace shows an error about an incomplete positioning update.
why the maneuver in the FID is not updated. The trace shows an error message that the guidance service is not registered.

@TomTom: Please check why a ~Follow maneuver~ with the wrong road type is announced on the road ~St2230~, thanks.

Such or similar issues should not occur and should be prevented by the following feature, please check this:

[FuncImpl] Follow maneuvers - Improvements (e.g. A60 -> B50)
https://devstack.vwgroup.com/jira/browse/AHCP3-201054?filter=437915

Current location: 51.41158146563119, 5.450754137092872
Stopover: TomTom Eindhoven, High Tech Campus 25, Eindhoven.
Destination: Amsterdam City Center

[OBSERVATION]
Many replannings happen in quick succession, as if the routing is not clear about the driving direction of the CVP. The maneuver box will be changing frequently to reflect the new maneuver.

For 1st occurrence, this happened when deviating by not turning right into Cipriano de Rorestraat from Van Blankenburgstraat. Proposed u-turn was on crossroad of 'Van Blankenburgstraat' and 'Cesar Franckstraat'.

See: deviation_loopingreplanning_1_Screencopy.mp4 and deviation_loopingreplanning_1_GoPro.mp4

For 2nd occurrence, this happened when deviating upon arrival at the stopover (as the stopover arrival was on top of a u-turn instruction, which is illegal there). See deviation_loopingreplanning_2_Screencopy.mp4 and deviation_loopingreplanning_2_GoPro.mp4:

[EXPECTATION]
When deviating, we get a single route replanning that results in a plausible guidance maneuver that can be driven towards and consumed.

[HEALING]
Will keep toggling until you:

1. Stand still to stop the 'deviations'.
2. Leave the road segment leading up to the new u-turn

[TIMESTAMPS]
Occurrence 1: 13:44
Occurrence 2: 16:25

[NOTE]
Esotraces for both events:
Occurrence 1: deviation-replanning-1.esotrace
Occurrence 2: deviation-replanning-2.esotrace

description_match_results.processed_description:
### Issue Description
**Title:** Looping recalculation when deviating onboard

**Precondition:** OFFLINE, DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance) automatic, Alternatives off, EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) on (25% at destination, 2% at CS (Charging Station)), EV (Electric Vehicle) mocked through OBD2. Route planned with a few stopovers.

**Observation:** Many replannings happen in quick succession, as if the routing is not clear about the driving direction of the CVP (Current Vehicle Position). The maneuver box will be changing frequently to reflect the new maneuver. For the 1st occurrence, this happened when deviating by not turning right into Cipriano de Rorestraat from Van Blankenburgstraat. Proposed u-turn was on the crossroad of 'Van Blankenburgstraat' and 'Cesar Franckstraat'. For the 2nd occurrence, this happened when deviating upon arrival at the stopover (as the stopover arrival was on top of a u-turn instruction, which is illegal there).

**Expectation:** When deviating, we get a single route replanning that results in a plausible guidance maneuver that can be driven towards and consumed.

**Healing:** Will keep toggling until you: 1. Stand still to stop the 'deviations'. 2. Leave the road segment leading up to the new u-turn.

description_match_results.processed_description:
### Issue Description
**Title:** Incorrect maneuver display navigation  
**Precondition:** Vehicle in motion, Route guidance active in navigation  
**Observation:** The implausible maneuver shown in the map CID (Central Information Display), FID ("Fahrer" Information Display (behind the wheel)) and HuD is "turn left 0m". The next maneuver "in 10m to the right" is also corrected after turning 50m.  
**Expectation:** Correct display of next maneuvers; occurs sporadically, even with false announcements, very annoying in big cities.  
**Healing:** Independently after independently turn to the right as shown on the map.  
**Reproducibility/Frequency:** No, rarely.

input.jira_analysis_finding: FB2R was triggered on partially resolved route after full resolving step. NIE couldn’t generate any instruction. Dummy is not added because system doesn’t think full resolving failed. Fixed in scope of HCP3EXT-6623 [PAG] [TomTom][HCP3][NAV] Empty maneuver bar >5 min-KD2 [10131753]. Closing as duplicate.
input.processed_description:
### Issue Description
**Title:** Empty NIP (Next Instruction Panel) / satellite mode

**Precondition:** Main user active -> vehicle is driving -> in CID (Central Information Display) Satmap with stopover in foreground -> Current position of the A72 -> Distance to the stopover is 119 km -> Next turning manoeuvre in approx. 40 km

**Observation:** In Satmap, the turn-by-turn information field is displayed empty and large.

**Expectation:** Adjusted size display in the field (photo 1738/1740).

**Healing:** Destination guidance cancelled and restart brought no cure -> OK after selecting alternative routes. 

**Frequency:** one-time

analysis_finding_match_results.jira_analysis_finding: why the route is calculated while the user is choosing an alternative route by decide by steering.

This is not a bug. Route is planned from an offroad location. In offroad location, we suppress guidance and voice instructions. HMI should show offroad state in the NIP and there will be no voice guidance announcements until the car moves to an onroad location.
why the better route proposal disappears shortly after proposing and why an alternative route is provided although the alternative routes are disabled (see minute 0:04 in the attached video).
why the system does not provide the best route. After deviation the route is one minute faster than the initial route.
why the route is not displayed although a route is active. Furthermore, the maneuvers are also not provided correctly.

After the insertion of a stop over only a single route (main route with the way point) is received from TomTom. Alternative routes are missing and therefore cannot be shown.

NOne

description_match_results.processed_description:
### Issue Description
**Title:** Alt auto replaced by faster immediate afte

**Precondition:** Route planned to Stuttgart; BE0, DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance) automatic, Alternatives on, EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) on, EV (Electric Vehicle) mocked through OBD2.

**Observation:** Alternatives are in the map. We select a slower alternative. Immediately after selection, the alternative gets replaced by the fastest (= initial) route. We hear "De route wordt naar aanleiding van de actuele verkeerssituatie veranderd." = "The route is changed based on the current traffic conditions".

**Expectation:** After the user manually selects a slower alternative, it should not automatically be replaced with a different route.

**Healing:** Manually select the slower alternative again: this time the alternative remained active.

input.jira_analysis_finding:
At the time of error the active route is a path alternative, therefore some restrictions regarding automatic switch to a better route are expected.

Whether there are any issue here ultimately can't be judged by HMI though because
1) The path alternative was selected via decide by steering. HMI can't judge whether this selection was appropriate

2) We don't know the thresholds/restrictions that NavCore should apply once a path alternative has been selected

why the access point of some POIs are unfavorable. In case of the lighthouse the route ends on a highway. According to TomTom and the database the issue is not in the map or software and must check by ESO.

### Issue Description
**Title:** no cs info when charingDestination is set

**Precondition:** Calculate a ev route in Volkswagen App and set final destination to a charging station.

**Observation:** No charging station information available in route response from the charging station, which was set as final destination.

**Expectation:** Charging station information like SoC, Charging Station name, charging power shall be available in the response, when customer set charging station as final destination.

**Healing:** NO

[Title]
 Wrong route guidance at Keihin-Kawasaki IC 

[PROBLEM DESCRIPTION]
Wrong route guidance at Keihin-Kawasaki IC.
The navigation system provided a route to get off the Daisan Keihin at the Keihin Kawasaki IC and get on the Daisan Keihin again.

[TEST CASE]
-

[TEST SETUP]
E6(vehicle)
HCP3 SW: S612
Navi apk: 46.243.20240826.SP04CW35AU01
Nav DB: CariadMap_JPN_0300_202403_IR053.0

[PRECONDITION]
1. Language is not relevant
2. Online
3. start: 35.610209471563884, 139.63918564483293
4. destination: 35.490186086139396, 139.58159313489398
5. CCP travel the provided route.(on Daisan-keihin, for Yokohama)

[ACTION]
1. Check route guidance near Keihin Kawasaki IC. (35.59570238843733, 139.62875854608066)

[OBSERVATION]
Wrong route guidance at Keihin-Kawasaki IC. (35.59570238843733, 139.62875854608066)
The navigation system provided a route to get off the Daisan Keihin at the Keihin Kawasaki IC and get on the Daisan Keihin again.
Since the Daisan Keihin is a toll road, an additional fee is required to get off at the IC and get back on.

[EXPECTATION]
Toll roads should not provide routes to get off and on.
Because of the additional charges and inconvenience to the user.

[ATTACHMENTS]
-Esotrace: log_20240827_002.esotrace.7z
-screenshot: 20240827_01_01.png

input.jira_analysis_finding: This is an old missing phonetic map data issue. Road type should be embedded to phonetic data so that road type and road number can be announced. Note that TomTom is also investigating to use road name for Japan. So that we can bypass such map data issue.
input.processed_description:
### Issue Description
**Title:** Road No. is not familiar with Japanese

**Precondition:**
- System language: Japanese
- Route guidance is active

**Observation:**
"123 wo 4 kiro me-toru susunde kudasai (EN: Proceed 123 in 4 kilometers)" is output <NOK>. This issue is also observed in other roads/expressways, e.g. "Tomei expressway" is output as "E1" but E1 is not familiar with Japanese; "Shuto expressway No.1 Haneda line" is output as "1" but "National road No.1" is also output as "1", causing confusion for Japanese users.

**Expectation:**
It should be output as "Todou 123 wo 4 kirome-toru susunde kudasai (EN: Proceed Tokyo municipal road No.123 in 4 kilometers).

**Healing:** NONE

ETA increases while travel time stays the same

Route towards Waldshut-Tiengen
Stopover 1: Restaurant Knossos [REACHED]
Stopover 2: 85107 Baar-Ebenhausen [REACHED]
Default starting location ingolstad

[ACTION]

Follow route

[OBSERVATION]

While following the route for over an hour, the ETA seems to be increasing the entire time while the driving time stays at 4h33 

at 0934 a refresh of some sorts happens, after which the traveltime stays solidly at 4:34
This can be seen in all the timestamped ETAAndTT images.

[EXPECTATION]

While driving towards a destination, the driving time should be decreasing and the ETA should remain roughly the same unless traffic starts appearing.

[HEALING]

description_match_results.processed_description:
### Issue Description
**Title:** ETT (Estimated Travel Time) stays the same

**Precondition:** BE9, DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance) on, alternatives off, default settings

**Observation:** While following the route for over an hour, the ETA (Estimated Time of Arrival) seems to be increasing the entire time while the driving time stays at 4h33. After a refresh, the travel time stays solidly at 4:34.

**Expectation:** While driving towards a destination, the driving time should be decreasing and the ETA (Estimated Time of Arrival) should remain roughly the same unless traffic starts appearing.

**Healing:** Need to cancel route and recreate route and then it happens again.

- At Dreieck Leonberg drive against recommended route (to Ludwigsburg) to Mahdental

2) New route is calculated
3) 5 times speech promt "Neue Optimierte Route verrfügbar" with according popup shortly displayed and then disappearing

[EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR]
3) Speech promt and popup only once when changing to new calculated route 
 
[HEALING]
- None

- Cluu#203977 "Bei aktiver ZF von Weissach nach Stuttgart wurde am Leonbergerkreut anstatt nach Ludwigsburg ins Mahdental abgebogen. input.jira_analysis_finding:
The issue is not reproducible on the production PR100 map because the transition at (35.44186,139.65020) is rightfully marked with the “BEAR” special transition code, which enforces guidance.

On the ER055 map (where the issue is found), this transition code is removed, and the "NO_ADVICE” special transition code is added for the same junction. The "NO_ADVICE" code here is not correct and, moreover, is not yet supported by Guidance.

This is a map issue. But what is bothering me is that this is not the first issue where the "BEAR" code in the PR map is changed to "NO_ADVICE" code in the ER0 map. These codes mean completely different things. "BEAR" enforces guidance, while "NO_ADVICE" suppresses it.

Please check!

description_match_results.description:
[Title]
TomTom Unexpected route update and ETA jumps 

[CONFIGURATION]
Audi e-tron 55 Technology Carrier - IN-MC-431E
VR: VR 38
Gateway SW (HCP5): HW: X14 SW: C662
ConMod SW: HW: 006 SW: X651
Head Unit SW: VR38_A13E_HCP3_AU_MRM_20240708_01_S612
VIN: BAUNEEGFZ21052708
Navigation APK:  TT_fastfeedback_SDK_2024.35.2-dev
Resource Provider APK: built-in from platform
NAV DB: CariadMap_EUR_0200_23122_PR047.1, OTA enabled

[SUMMARY]
Unexpected route updates and jumping ETA after deviating from CS.

[PRECONDITION]
CVP in Veldhoven here: 51.43163557667747, 5.422047317842646
Route planned to Legoland.
DRG = Auto and Alternative Routes = ON.
currentEnergyContent = ~11kWh out of 92kWh ~= 12% SoC
Route included CS Robocharge ElectraClear Adriaanse at Meerenakkerplein 55, Eindhoven to charge from 11% to 71%. 

[ACTION]
When approaching the CS, deviate from the route by going straight along the parallel side-road back towards the nearby roundabout.

Arrival at CS is shown on 1235_arrivalAtCS.png

[OBSERVATION]
We deviate from route within CS range, so no FB2R happens until leaving the 100m circle. OK
See: 1236_noReplanAfterDeviationWithin100mFromCS.png

We leave the 100m circle, and FB2R happens. Route and guidance instructions are shown again and are correct. However, the ETA has changed from 21:49 to 22:07? See 1236_FB2RbacktoCS_ETA2207.png.

We deviate again by ignoring the U-turn. Still the ETA is 22:07.
Suddenly the NMB shows '0m to Robocharge' as if we had arrived at CS, but only for a fraction of a second. See: 1236_NMBshowsArrivalAtCSIncorrect.png

At this point, the location indication in the NMB disappears (only shows turn and distance info) and the ETA drops to 21:40 (??). See: 1236_NMBEmpty_ETAdropped27mins.png

 Then we get presented with a new route, but the ETA is now back up to 22:02, see:1236_NewRoute_ETA2202.png

One second later, the ETA is updated to 22:06? Traffic harmonization maybe??
Route gets automatically updated due to "current travel situation". ETA changes to 21:50?? See: 1236_RouteUpdateDueToTravelSituation_ETAdropped 26mins.png

See ~2min video for more details (on ETF): ETAandBRP.mp4

[EXPECTATION]

I cannot explain all the jumps in ETA and weird route update behavior. I would expect the tour plan to remain more constant when only making minor deviation in the vicinity of a CS. Such deviations should trigger FB2Rs and not cause route updates of ~25 min difference in ETA.

[HEALING]

N/A 

[CONTACT]
frank.spierings@tomtom.com
matthijs.koot@tomtom.com
ttdrivetesting
description_match_results.processed_description:

**Precondition:** 
- CVP (Current Vehicle Position) in Veldhoven: 51.43163557667747, 5.422047317842646
- Route planned to Legoland.
- DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance) = Auto and Alternative Routes = ON.
- currentEnergyContent = ~11kWh out of 92kWh ~= 12% SoC

**Observation:**

[Title]
TomTom Unexpected route update and ETA jumps 

[CONFIGURATION]
Audi e-tron 55 Technology Carrier - IN-MC-431E
VR: VR 38
Gateway SW (HCP5): HW: X14 SW: C662
ConMod SW: HW: 006 SW: X651
Head Unit SW: VR38_A13E_HCP3_AU_MRM_20240708_01_S612
VIN: BAUNEEGFZ21052708
Navigation APK:  TT_fastfeedback_SDK_2024.35.2-dev
Resource Provider APK: built-in from platform
NAV DB: CariadMap_EUR_0200_23122_PR047.1, OTA enabled

[SUMMARY]
Unexpected route updates and jumping ETA after deviating from CS.

[PRECONDITION]
CVP in Veldhoven here: 51.43163557667747, 5.422047317842646
Route planned to Legoland.
DRG = Auto and Alternative Routes = ON.
currentEnergyContent = ~11kWh out of 92kWh ~= 12% SoC
Route included CS Robocharge ElectraClear Adriaanse at Meerenakkerplein 55, Eindhoven to charge from 11% to 71%. 

[ACTION]
When approaching the CS, deviate from the route by going straight along the parallel side-road back towards the nearby roundabout.

Arrival at CS is shown on 1235_arrivalAtCS.png

[OBSERVATION]
We deviate from route within CS range, so no FB2R happens until leaving the 100m circle. OK
See: 1236_noReplanAfterDeviationWithin100mFromCS.png

We leave the 100m circle, and FB2R happens. Route and guidance instructions are shown again and are correct. However, the ETA has changed from 21:49 to 22:07? See 1236_FB2RbacktoCS_ETA2207.png.

We deviate again by ignoring the U-turn. Still the ETA is 22:07.
Suddenly the NMB shows '0m to Robocharge' as if we had arrived at CS, but only for a fraction of a second. See: 1236_NMBshowsArrivalAtCSIncorrect.png

At this point, the location indication in the NMB disappears (only shows turn and distance info) and the ETA drops to 21:40 (??). See: 1236_NMBEmpty_ETAdropped27mins.png

 Then we get presented with a new route, but the ETA is now back up to 22:02, see:1236_NewRoute_ETA2202.png

One second later, the ETA is updated to 22:06? Traffic harmonization maybe??
Route gets automatically updated due to "current travel situation". ETA changes to 21:50?? See: 1236_RouteUpdateDueToTravelSituation_ETAdropped 26mins.png

See ~2min video for more details (on ETF): ETAandBRP.mp4

[EXPECTATION]

I cannot explain all the jumps in ETA and weird route update behavior. I would expect the tour plan to remain more constant when only making minor deviation in the vicinity of a CS. Such deviations should trigger FB2Rs and not cause route updates of ~25 min difference in ETA.

[HEALING]

N/A 

[CONTACT]
frank.spierings@tomtom.com
matthijs.koot@tomtom.com
ttdrivetesting

System OFFLINE
EV route planner ON, SoC targets both at 10%.

[ACTION]
Route planned to Paris City Center.

[OBSERVATION]

16:49 CET

input.processed_description:
### Issue Description
**Title:** Unrealistic ETA (Estimated Time of Arrival) and SoC on LDEV

**Precondition:**  
Route planned from Porsche Hemmingen to TomTom Eindhoven with stop-overs at Flughafen Stuttgart and Pastoor Max Leessensstraat 8, Elsloo. BE8, DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance) automatic, Alternatives off, EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) on (default), EV (Electric Vehicle) mocked through OBD2.

**Observation:**  
The initial route was planned at 13:30. At ~14:29, the ETA for the next stop-over was showing ~22:36, while a more realistic ETA was ~20:32. By 15:00, the ETA increased to 23:44. The route between the first and second charging stop was unrealistic, taking almost 5 hours for 167km. The arrival SoC at the charging station did not change despite deviations from the route. At 15:45, the SoC was ~50%, making it impossible to arrive with 27% SoC. The routing did not calculate alternatives and kept directing back to Stuttgart. After charging at a CS (Charging Station) from 16:32 - 17:02, the route did not update the current SoC until 17:08, after which the ETA dropped significantly.

**Expectation:**  
ETA should always be realistic. Arrival SoC should update when the charge or route changes. The route should update to a more optimal path after multiple deviations.

**Healing:**  
At 17:08, the new SoC was incorporated into the route, resulting in a significant drop in ETA from 3:31 to 20:57 (6hr34 faster).

Resource Provider APK: built-in from platform
NAV DB: CariadMap_EUR_0300_24122_PR108.0
?
[SUMMARY]
On-board no CS BRP with unreachable route

[PRECONDITION]
Route planned from TomTom Eindhoven to Pastoor Max Leessensstraat 8, Elsloo
On-board, DRG semi-dynamic, Alternatives on, EVTP on (25% at destination, 10% at CS), EV mocked through OBD2
CVP was off-road during initial planning (~ 51.41244036820732, 5.451002368898684)

[ACTION]
Follow guidance

[OBSERVATION]
Initially, the route was planned with an arrival SoC of 26%. This matches the set arrival SoC by the user in the EVTP settings of 25%. For this, no charging station was required to reach the destination.

Route: 83285ba3, Trip: cc4ab168

At 17:22, the arrival SoC changes to 25% (= OK).
At 17:31, the arrival SoC changes to 24% (= OK with the margin).
At 17:43, the arrival SoC changes to 23% (= OK with the margin).
At 17:50, the arrival SoC changes to 22% (= NOK).
At 17:58, the arrival SoC changes to 21% (= NOK).
At 18:05, the arrival SoC changes to 20% (= NOK).

When the SoC dropped below the set target and it's margin, no BRP was presented to the user which suggests taking a CS, to arrive at the destination with the set SoC.
Image: 1805EVTPSettings.jpg

Also checking all the alternatives, no CS were added.
Image: 1806Alternatives.jpg

Eventually we reach the destination at 18:17 with an arrival SoC of 20% without any charge plan BRP.

[EXPECTATION]
Charge plan BRP should be presented to the user when the destination becomes unreachable according to the EVTP settings.

[HEALING]
/

[TIMESTAMP]
17:16 
17:46
18:16

[NOTE]
Full logs attached as it was observed over a longer period of time

[CONTACT]
matthijs.koot@tomtom.com
frank.spierings@tomtom.com
ttdrivetesting

**Precondition:** Route planned from TomTom Eindhoven to Pastoor Max Leessensstraat 8, Elsloo. On-board, DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance) semi-dynamic, Alternatives on, EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) on (25% at destination, 10% at CS (Charging Station)), EV (Electric Vehicle) mocked through OBD2. CVP (Current Vehicle Position) was off-road during initial planning (~ 51.41244036820732, 5.451002368898684).

**Observation:** Initially, the route was planned with an arrival SoC of 26%. As the trip progressed, the arrival SoC dropped below the set target of 25% without any BRP (Better Route Proposal) suggesting a CS (Charging Station) to reach the destination. Eventually, the destination was reached at 18:17 with an arrival SoC of 20% without any charge plan BRP.

**Expectation:** Charge plan BRP (Better Route Proposal) should be presented to the user when the destination becomes unreachable according to the EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) settings.

**Healing:** /

description_match_results.description:
[Title]
 No navigation announcements 

VR 28.11.01 / Navigationsansagen ohne Funktion

Fahrzeug: AU513458516/ WAUZZZGH0SA000524

Vorbedingungen: Fahrzeug Stand/Fahrt->Fahrzeug fährt->Kl. 15 an-> CID & FID aktiv -> Navigation im CID mit aktiver Zielführung -> Navigationsansagen aktiv auf Komplett & auf mittlerer Lautstärke

Tatsächliches Verhalten: Trotz aktiver Navigationsansagen wird bei keinerlei Manöver eine Ansage der Navigation gemacht. Auch bei deaktivieren & erneutem Aktivieren der Ansagen ist nicht wie zu erwarten eine Ansage wahrzunehmen. Auch bei Verstellen der Lautstärke der Ansagen auf Maximum ist weiterhin keine Ausgabe der Ansagen verfügbar. Im CID Menü Einstellungen -> Ton ist unter dem Punkt Lautstärke Navigationsansagen die Lautstärke auf Maximum eingestellt. Ebenfalls hat das Fahrzeug weder Kopfstützen mit Tonausgabe verbaut, noch ist der Menüpunkt im Ton Menü vorhanden & somit auch nicht aktiviert.

Heilung: Keine

Häufigkeit: immer / reproduzierbar

Anhänge + Zeit: 17.09.2024 -> 23:01h->Trace->Video->23322km

[SG 005F] SW-Version: Q346
[SG 0019] SW-Version: 0043
[SG 0017] SW-Version: Q158
Link zum Trace, Video und Fehlerspeicher im Dokumentenanhang.
Querverweis zur Cluu-BA: 4647751

Heilung:??Keine
Häufigkeit:??immer
Datum + Uhrzeit:?17.09.2024 23:01
Anhänge: ??Trace & Video
#MEDAPF=2024-09-17-23:01:00#
*#*
VDS.Nr.: AU513458516
VIN: WAUZZZGH0SA000524
Backend:
Fzg.-Nummer: AU513458516
Projekt-SOP: KW15/24
Anlauf-ID: 
teVBV: PPE_VR28.11.01_KW29.5
*#*

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

VR 28.11.01 / Navigation announcements without function

Vehicle: AU513458516/ WAUZZZGH0SA000524

Prerequisites: Vehicle stationary/driving->Vehicle driving->class 15 on-> CID & FID active -> navigation in CID with active route guidance -> navigation announcements active on complete & at medium volume

Actual behavior: Despite active navigation announcements, no navigation announcement is made during any maneuvers. Even when deactivating & reactivating the announcements, an announcement cannot be perceived as expected. Even if the volume of the announcements is adjusted to maximum, no output of the announcements is still available. In the CID menu Settings -> Sound, the volume is set to maximum under the item Volume, navigation announcements. The vehicle also has neither headrests with sound output installed, nor is the menu item in the sound menu available and therefore not activated.

Cure: None

Frequency: always / reproducible

Attachments + Time: 17.09.2024 -> 23:01h->Trace->Video->23322km

[SG 005F] SW version: Q346
[SG 0019] B&W Version: 0043
[SG 0017] B&W version: Q158
Link to the trace, video and error memory in the document attachment.
Cross-reference to the Cluu-BA: 4647751

Cure: None
Frequency: always
Date + Time: 17.09.2024 23:01
Attachments: Trace & Video
description_match_results.processed_description:
### Issue Description
- **Title**: No navigation announcements
- **Issue**: Navigation announcements without function
- **Precondition**: Vehicle stationary/driving -> Vehicle driving -> class 15 on -> CID (Central Information Display) & FID ("Fahrer" Information Display (behind the wheel)) active -> navigation in CID (Central Information Display) with active route guidance -> navigation announcements active on complete & at medium volume
- **Observation**: Despite active navigation announcements, no announcement is made during any maneuvers. Deactivating & reactivating the announcements does not produce any sound. Volume set to maximum, but no output is available. The vehicle lacks headrests with sound output, and the relevant menu item is not available.
- **Expectation**: Navigation announcements should be audible during maneuvers.
- **Healing**: None

input.jira_analysis_finding: The issue was reported on 43.242.20240610.SP06CW24AU01_DET4OTA (= 2024.22.1-DET4OTA). The issue does only occur during map update when map is temporarily unavailable while POIs are being read from map. The older DET4OTA SW will treat the MapUnavailable status as a fatal error. This means that in such case the POI map data producer will stop producing data until it is restarted. The POI map data producer is only restarted when Navigation is restarted, e.g., on the next bus-cycle. This behavior has recently been fixed on mainline under KPM 10224041. The new behavior for handling MapUnavailable status on mainline is to return an empty result. The POI map data producer will then continue running and return results as soon as the MapUnavailable status has been resolved, i.e., map is available again.

description_match_results.description:
[Title]
  Unnecessary online traffic announcement 

[FUNCTION]
Navigation - online traffic
 
[SHORT TEXT]
Unnecessary online traffic announcement
  
[TIME STAMP]
13:28 13.09.2024 (JST), 06:28 13.09.2024 (UTC)
 
[PRECONDITION]
P1 : Navi routeguidance active
P2:  Online traffic is available
 
[ACTION]
A1 : Drive the car along the route
A2 : Receive online traffic data for "slow traffic"
 
[OBSERVED BEHAVIOUR]
O2 : Navi announces "Attention. Latest online traffic is received" without any re-caclulation of the route [NOK]
 
[EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR]
Such announcement like "Attention. Latest online traffic is received" supposed to only happen when there is better route and this alternative route is proposed to customer. No announcement is necessary every time system receives "slow traffic info".
 
[RECOVERY]
None
 
[FREQUENCY]
- Frequency: Always
- Reproducible: Yes
- Generic or Specific: Generic error
 
[TEST SETUP]
HCP3

- SW: S630
- Part number: 8B3035020E
ConMod
- HW: H20
- SW: 0657
- Part number: 85E035283
HCP5
- HW: H24

- Part number: 85F907468

Video
Logs

description_match_results.processed_description:
### Issue Description
**Title:** Unnecessary online traffic announcement  
**Precondition:**  
- P1: Navi route guidance active  
- P2: Online traffic is available  
**Observation:** Navi announces "Attention. Latest online traffic is received" without any re-calculation of the route [NOK]  
**Expectation:** Such announcement like "Attention. Latest online traffic is received" is supposed to only happen when there is a better route and this alternative route is proposed to the customer. No announcement is necessary every time the system receives "slow traffic info."  
**Healing:** None

description_match_results.description:
[Title]
Too early announcem. to exit a Round-about 

[PROBLEM DESCRIPTION]
During test drive in Koesching, it is observed that announcement for exiting the Round-about (Koeschinger Tor) is made 1, 2 exits earlier.

[TEST SETUP]
HCP3 SW: S603
HCP5 SW: C360
ConMod SW: 0651
Navigation APK: 46.243.20240829.SP05CW36AU01
NAV DB: HCP3_EUR_45_23109_IR042.0

[PRECONDITION]
Active RG passing through a roundabout, default navigation settings

[ACTION]
(A1) - With active RG, drive through a round-about that has more than 4 exits ( Round-about at Koeschinger Tor in our case ).
(A2) - Take 2, 3 turns instead of taking exit and observe the position of car and the announcement.

[OBSERVATION]
(O1) - OK
(O2) - On each turn, announcements to exit is made one or two exits earlier than the exit which is supposed to be taken.

[EXPECTATION]
(E1) - Exit announcement should be made just before the Exit which is supposed to be taken.

[HEALING]
None

[ATTACHMENTS] 
Please see documents section for traces and media

Contact: 
Ishaq, Malik Shoaib : ext.malik.shoaib.ishaq@digiteqautomotive.com

analysis_finding_match_results.jira_analysis_finding:
One more clarification from RG Side:

1) If there are only links, we use link.attributes_x.number_entry_exit_lanes_right and link.attributes_x.number_entry_exit_lanes_left. (https://devstack.vwgroup.com/bitbucket/projects/HML/repos/psd-interface/browse/proto3/vwg/psd/link.proto#227)

2) If there are lanes available and we are lane-localized we use lane_group.lanes.lane_type
(https://devstack.vwgroup.com/bitbucket/projects/HML/repos/psd-interface/browse/proto3/vwg/psd/lane_group.proto#104)

This looks like a map issue that has been fixed in a following map *update*. Although the map is named the same (KOR_0300_24M8_PR107.0), I can clearly see that the lane data from the log file is different from the one we have here (on TT Korean VM) after applying all updates (we're on update #14), at the same map location. For example, the log file from Dec 11 shows lane group #42 (where the missing lane is) is followed by lane group #75, #76 and #63. In the map we have here, lane group #42 (assigned to a Road Geo Line #1 at 37.52771,127.19492) is followed by lane groups #92, #93 and #80 (see link 27 at 37.53322,127.19131). Suggesting to apply all updates available for map KOR_0300_24M8_PR107.0 (up to 14) and retest.

@TomTom issue was not reproducible. Please confirm the location and the database version.

See MS CCB: 
- At 37.51767701532115, 126.94436940961208 in ER056 KOR, there is no lanegroup with Id: 83 or 75.
 !ER056.png|thumbnail!
why the route ends on the opposite lane. According to the database the access point is correct.

input.jira_analysis_finding:
This is a map issue. Lane connectivity is broken. 

This is the link right before the exit. It has laneGroup with ID 23. This laneGroup has 5 laneConnectivityElements. The curb-most laneConnectivityElements[0]'s destLaneConnectorId is 385. The corresponding sourceLaneConnectorId 385 is in laneGroup with ID 13. laneGroup 13 is assigned to the link with ID 11, which is not the exit link. That means the curb-most lane is not leading to the exit line. This is wrong.

analysis_finding_match_results.jira_analysis_finding: as we dont expect such scenarios to happen frequently i would shift it to CL8 and like to understand which logic is implemented on tomtom side to trigger new alternatives after reaching waypoints/stopovers to prevent such a wrong routing.

Please check the behavior on ESO side as mentioned from TomTom, see comments below. 

About second one part that result of route replan was now shown to user I think maybe eSo rendering team or integration team should check this moment.
why the route is guided to a side road instead of guiding straight ahead on the main road. One assumption is that the re-routing is based on a traffic light.
why the route is calculated while the user is choosing an alternative route by decide by steering.
why the route is not eaten up behind the carsor and why the maneuver is shown as "offroad" although the car is on road, see position information.

[ENVIRONMENT]

ttdesktesting

Map: CariadMap_EUR_0200_23122_PR047.1
Backend: 9
VIN: BAUHHMF4720101901
NavApp: TT_feedback_SDK_2024.47.12-dev
SDK: As provided by NavApp

[SUMMARY]

Reached stopover is reactivated

[PRECONDITION]

BE9, DRG on, EVTP on, Alternatives off, Default settings
Route from (51.4149980885707,5.429293878620975)
Destination: Lehnhausen
Stopover 1: Geer 10, Veldhoven??[REACHED] (selected through POI police search)
Stopover 2: Mastebeek 2, Veldhoven?[REACHED] (manually selected on map)

[ACTION]

Add a stopover (In this case Dennebeek 6) by clicking the map near Stopover 2 at the moment the CVP goes onto the roundabout.

[OBSERVATION]

When the new charging plan is finished calculating and activated, the old stopover (Stopover 1: Geer 10, Veldhoven) is suddenly activated again.
This stopover has not been interacted anymore after adding it before reaching it.

This happens before the CVP starts to jump around due to route demo.

[EXPECTATION]

Old stopovers should not be reactivated 

[HEALING]

Stopover gets removed after being reached again

[ADDITIONAL INFO]

-

[CONTACT]

pepijn.michels@tomtom.com
mieke.vaneijck@tomtom.com
description_match_results.processed_description:
### Issue Description
**Title:** Reached stopover is reactivated

**Precondition:** BE9, DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance) on, EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) on, Alternatives off, Default settings  
Route from (51.4149980885707,5.429293878620975)  
Destination: Lehnhausen  
Stopover 1: Geer 10, Veldhoven??[REACHED] (selected through POI (Place Of Interest) police search)  
Stopover 2: Mastebeek 2, Veldhoven?[REACHED] (manually selected on map)

**Observation:** When the new charging plan is finished calculating and activated, the old stopover (Stopover 1: Geer 10, Veldhoven) is suddenly activated again. This stopover has not been interacted with anymore after adding it before reaching it. This happens before the CVP (Current Vehicle Position) starts to jump around due to route demo.

**Expectation:** Old stopovers should not be reactivated 

**Healing:** Stopover gets removed after being reached again

[SUMMARY]
Strange charge plan with CS off route (detour)

[PRECONDITION]
Route planned to TomTom Paris with as stop-over Pastoor Max Leessensstraat 8, Elsloo
BE8, DRG automatic, Alternatives on, EVTP on (10% target CS, 2% target destination), EV mocked through OBD2

[ACTION]
Follow road

[OBSERVATION]
Due to a positioning issue (GPS only Technology Carrier), we were mismatched on the N2 instead of the A2. At 09:18, this recovers, and the CVP is set to the correct road (A2). Immediately, we receive a BRP route update which changes the charging plan:
Image: 0918BRP.jpg

Observing the route with the charging plan, an unnecessary detour is added to the route to reach a CS (Fastned Meelakkers):
Image: 0922ChargeplanDetour.jpg

ETA at the stop-over with this CS in the route is 10:49.

After observing this, we remove that CS. Now, BP Pulse Burgemeester Mollaan is added. This also requires a detour, and an ETA at the stop-over of 10:58. After also removing that CS, a CS along the route is added (Fastned 't Haasje). The arrival SoC here is 14%, well within the set EVTP settings. ETA at the stop-over for this CS is now 10:43.

See video 0921WeirdCSSelection.mp4

[EXPECTATION]
When there are reachable CS available along the route, a detour off-route to charge shouldn't be proposed.

[HEALING]
Remove the suggested CS twice manually.

[TIMESTAMP]
09:18

[CONTACT]
matthijs.koot@tomtom.com
pepijn.michels@tomtom.com
ttdrivetesting

### Issue Description
**Title:** TomTom Charge plan with CS (Charging Station) off-route

**Precondition:** Route planned to TomTom Paris with a stop-over at Pastoor Max Leessensstraat 8, Elsloo BE8, DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance) automatic, Alternatives on, EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) on (10% target CS (Charging Station), 2% target destination), EV (Electric Vehicle) mocked through OBD2.

**Observation:** Due to a positioning issue (GPS only Technology Carrier), we were mismatched on the N2 instead of the A2. At 09:18, this recovers, and the CVP (Current Vehicle Position) is set to the correct road (A2). Immediately, we receive a BRP (Better Route Proposal) route update which changes the charging plan, adding an unnecessary detour to reach a CS (Charging Station) (Fastned Meelakkers). After removing that CS (Charging Station), another (BP Pulse Burgemeester Mollaan) is added, also requiring a detour. Finally, a CS (Charging Station) along the route (Fastned 't Haasje) is added, with an arrival SoC of 14%, well within the set EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) settings.

**Expectation:** When there are reachable CS (Charging Station) available along the route, a detour off-route to charge shouldn't be proposed.

**Healing:** Remove the suggested CS (Charging Station) twice manually.

analysis_finding_match_results.jira_analysis_finding:
Here’s the comment added by the expert from the analysis finding:

"Here’s a diagram to explain in more detail. The yellow mark in Lane D shows where a lane merge is happening - we penalise this option since being in a merging lane is inconvenient for the driver. More importantly though, driving from E to X, if you change lanes before the yellow section you need to change lanes twice, whereas if you wait until after the yellow section you only need to change lanes once. So we prefer the second option. Whereas driving from D to V it makes sense to change before the yellow section, in order to perform three single-lane changes instead of changing multiple lanes at once. This leads to the recommended lanes highlighted in cyan, with a gap between them. This is why it’s expected to have a gap in recommendations in some situations."
Please check the wrong lane widget / lane recommendation, thanks.

Please check the questions of the supplier from maprendering side why the lane recommendation is shown above solid line. From routing/guidance side the log file looks consistent according to the supplier.
why the guidance often recommends only one lane although there are more than one lane in the same direction.
analyze needed why most right lane is recommended instead of most left lane.

input.jira_analysis_finding:
Hi Matthew, I don't think it's only a rendering issue. Please take a look at the visualization of the lane recommendation in the LaneView, HCP3KPM\-91041_ZuerichNord.png.

LaneGroupIDs based on DB int_CariadMap_EUR_0300_24122_PR108.0_NDS.

The Lane recommendation switches from one lane to two lanes at location A. This is LaneGroup 176 in tile 545351868.

We would expect that only the rightmost lane of LaneGroup 176 is recommended. At the start of LaneGroup 229 also the rightmost lane should be recommended. Only at the end of LaneGroup 229 (after the split of roads) or at the next LaneGroup 895 the recommendation should switch to both lanes (Location B).

On the right side of the image I marked in magenta which lanes we would expect not to be recommended.

Hope this makes the issue clearer. Can you please check again?
input.processed_description:
### Issue Description
**Title:** Recommendation is unusual/not optimal

**Precondition:** 
- Position mocking service is available and working.
- Internet connection. (APN1)
- Lane data was already downloaded via OTA (Over-the-air map update)

**Observation:** 
The lane recommendation is to enter the new motorway or switch into one of the inner lanes. At the next exit, both recommended lanes show toward the two-laned exit.

**Expectation:** 
As a driver, staying on the rightmost lane is the best option since you cannot accidentally miss the exit. The recommendation to spread onto both lanes of the exit should rather come after the split.

**Healing:** 
The same lane recommendation is different (like expectation) when the route is started from a different location, closer to the maneuver.

analysis_finding_match_results.jira_analysis_finding: why the route changed immediately although the user do not deviate or switch to an alternative route. The announcements triggered by the route calculation is annoying. Furthermore the device is offline, so no traffic updates should be triggered. Please check if this is the same root cause like in KPM 10175049.

In any case, this is most likely a duplicate of https://tomtom.atlassian.net/browse/NAV-131736 , https://tomtom.atlassian.net/browse/NAV-128367 , https://tomtom.atlassian.net/browse/NAV-147765 , where the destination characteristics are not passed on to the instruction engine. Without this, we cannot select the best toward information from the signpost. Please add logs with the route in question (ideally only with that route).
why the route is guided to a side road instead of guiding straight ahead on the main road. One assumption is that the re-routing is based on a traffic light.
why the route is calculated this way. According to the tester it is a dangerous situation, see also KPM 9314637.
why the route guided to a detour instead of guiding straight ahead. Please check if this is the same root cause like in KPM 10081878.

[Title]
 Road closure not announced by VG 

[CONFIGURATION]
Audi e-tron 55 Technology Carrier - IN-MC-431E
VR: VR40
Gateway SW (HCP5): HW: X14 SW: D260
ConMod SW: HW: 006 SW: X658
Head Unit SW: VR40_A13E_HCP3_AU_MRM_20240925_01_S651
VIN: BAUNEEGFZ21052708
Navigation APK: TT_fastfeedback_SDK_2024.47.1-dev
Resource Provider APK: built-in from platform
NAV DB: CariadMap_EUR_0300_24122_PR108.0

[SUMMARY]
Road closure not announced by VG

[PRECONDITION]
Route planned to Oslo
BE8, DRG automatic, Alternatives off, EVTP on (default), EV mocked through OBD2

[ACTION]
Follow guidance, observe NavInfoBox

[OBSERVATION]
At 12:43, we plan a route to Oslo. The ETA is shown as green. 
Route: 9b347347, Trip: 2777d1af
~20 seconds after the route is calculated, a road closure is shown in the map. VG does not mention this road closure in the route.
Image: 1243RoadClosure.jpg
Traffic ID 1522371797
Image: 1244RoadClosure.jpg

At 12:51, we planned a new route to Oslo
Route: aa0d45f6, Trip: 6bc938c1
Behavior is the same: after calculation, no road closure is in the route. When it appeared in the route (at 12:52), it was not announced by VG. 

At 12:58 (route 7f17f9c1), it was also added to the route again without notification after it was removed by a BRP.

[EXPECTATION]
As soon as the road closure comes in to the route, an announcement should be made alerting the driver that a road closure is in the route.

[HEALING]
After we deviate 3-4 minutes after the road closure appeared in the route, a VG announcement is given: "Attention. The route contains a complete road closure."

[TIMESTAMP]
12:43, 12:51, 12:58

[NOTE]
Full logs can be found at https://etf.esolutions.de/user/?etf_id=6116725

[CONTACT]
matthijs.koot@tomtom.com
frank.spierings@tomtom.com
ttdrivetesting
description_match_results.processed_description:
### Issue Description
**Title:** Road closure not announced by VG (Voice Guidance) 

**Precondition:** Route planned to Oslo; BE8, DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance) automatic, Alternatives off, EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) on (default), EV (Electric Vehicle) mocked through OBD2.

**Observation:** At 12:43, a route to Oslo was planned, and a road closure appeared on the map approximately 20 seconds after calculation, but VG (Voice Guidance) did not announce it. This behavior repeated at 12:51 and 12:58, where road closures were added to the route without notification.

**Expectation:** An announcement should be made alerting the driver of any road closure as soon as it is included in the route.

**Healing:** After deviating 3-4 minutes post road closure appearance, VG (Voice Guidance) announced: "Attention. The route contains a complete road closure."

input.jira_analysis_finding: Bad restriction handling has been fixed. Please retest with 2024.51.6
input.processed_description:
### Issue Description
**Title:** Warning for restricted road not given for  
**Issue:** The audio warning for "stopover at road with restricted access" is not announced when it is the second stopover on the trip, but the first stopover gets removed from the trip.  
**Precondition:** BE8, DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance) semi-dynamic, Alternatives on, EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) on (default settings), EV (Electric Vehicle) mocked through OBD2.  
**Observation:** The audio warning for the 2nd stopover is not given.  
**Expectation:** It would be appreciated to hear the warning about an upcoming stopover being located on a restricted access road when needed, to prevent running into unexpected surprises in guidance.  
**Healing:** It was announced after a deviation occurred and FB2R (Fast Back To Route) happened.

### Issue Description
**Title:** Corrupted chargeplan after deviate S2R (Suspend to ram)  

**Precondition:** Route planned to Rouen; BE8, DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance) semi-dynamic, Alternatives on, EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) on (default), EV (Electric Vehicle) mocked through OBD2  

**Observation:** At 15:09, an S2R (Suspend to ram) is triggered with a valid route to Rouen. After resuming at 15:11 and immediately deviating, the route initially appears to recover. **Expectation:** Charging plan remains stable, and the charging stations in the route should be maintained in the charging plan.  

**Healing:** A BRP (Better Route Proposal) was suggested with a valid charging plan: user could select the BRP (Better Route Proposal).

input.processed_description:
### Issue Description
**Title:** Route to Paris loses charging plan 

**Precondition:** Plan a route to Paris with BE8, DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance) semi-dynamic, Alternatives on, EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) on (default settings), EV (Electric Vehicle) mocked through OBD2.

**Observation:** The route to Paris initially contains a valid charging plan but loses it shortly after planning, requiring recalculation. The charging plan takes over a minute to recover and appears to be calculated on-board. This issue was observed multiple times during the drive.

**Expectation:** When the system has a valid charging plan, this charging plan should remain stable.

**Healing:** There was no automatic healing observed; the route kept changing between valid and invalid charging plans during the drive.

analysis_finding_match_results.jira_analysis_finding: why the route changed immediately although the user do not deviate or switch to an alternative route. The announcements triggered by the route calculation is annoying.
why the system does not provide the best route. After deviation the route is one minute faster than the initial route.
if there is a possibility to restart the route after the map update. For the customer this is not comprehensible why the route could not be calculated.]

why the route changed immediately although the user do not deviate or switch to an alternative route. The announcements triggered by the route calculation is annoying. Furthermore the device is offline, so no traffic updates should be triggered. Please check if this is the same root cause like in KPM 10175049.
why the announcements are unplausible if an alternative route is available or not. Here, the announcement is provided although two alternative routes are available.

[SUMMARY]
On-board no CS BRP with unreachable route

[PRECONDITION]
Route planned from TomTom Eindhoven to Pastoor Max Leessensstraat 8, Elsloo
On-board, DRG semi-dynamic, Alternatives on, EVTP on (25% at destination, 10% at CS), EV mocked through OBD2
CVP was off-road during initial planning (~ 51.41244036820732, 5.451002368898684)

[ACTION]
Follow guidance

[OBSERVATION]
Initially, the route was planned with an arrival SoC of 26%. This matches the set arrival SoC by the user in the EVTP settings of 25%. For this, no charging station was required to reach the destination.

Route: 83285ba3, Trip: cc4ab168

At 17:22, the arrival SoC changes to 25% (= OK).
At 17:31, the arrival SoC changes to 24% (= OK with the margin).
At 17:43, the arrival SoC changes to 23% (= OK with the margin).
At 17:50, the arrival SoC changes to 22% (= NOK).
At 17:58, the arrival SoC changes to 21% (= NOK).
At 18:05, the arrival SoC changes to 20% (= NOK).

When the SoC dropped below the set target and it's margin, no BRP was presented to the user which suggests taking a CS, to arrive at the destination with the set SoC.
Image: 1805EVTPSettings.jpg

Also checking all the alternatives, no CS were added.
Image: 1806Alternatives.jpg

Eventually we reach the destination at 18:17 with an arrival SoC of 20% without any charge plan BRP.

[EXPECTATION]
Charge plan BRP should be presented to the user when the destination becomes unreachable according to the EVTP settings.

[HEALING]
/

[TIMESTAMP]
17:16 
17:46
18:16

[NOTE]
Full logs attached as it was observed over a longer period of time

[SUMMARY]
Multiple EVTP PU followed by charge plan BRP

[PRECONDITION]
Route planned to Pastoor Max Leessensstraat 8, Elsloo

BE8, DRG semi-dynamic, Alternatives on, EVTP on (20% SoC at dest), EV mocked through OBD2

[ACTION]
Follow guidance with a higher consumption

[OBSERVATION]
At 22:02, we receive a BRP because we cannot reach the destination with our current charging plan (we will arrive at the destination with 17% while our destination target SoC is set to 20%) (= OK)
Image: 2202DRG.jpg

We decide to ignore this BRP. The BRP remains in the RM until the decision point (= OK)
Image: 2207BRPStillAvailable.jpg

After passing the decision point for the BRP, and this not taking the BRP, we receive an EVTP PU stating that the destination cannot be reached with the current charge planning, and that no alternative available is.
Image: 2207EVTPPU.jpg

Immediately followed by a BRP:
Image: 2207BRP.jpg

This behavior occurred for almost every BRP not being selected.

2207EVTPPU-BRP.mp4

Video: 2207EVTPPU-BRP.mp4

2208Announcements.mp4

Video: 2208Announcements.mp4

[EXPECTATION]
EVTP PU's should only be should only be shown when there really is no other

[HEALING]
/ - Ignore all BRP's and EVTP PU's until we reach the destination.

Alternatively, the user could've disabled the EVTP and/or decreased the destination SoC target

description_match_results.processed_description:
### Issue Description
**Title:** TomTom Multiple EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) PU (Product Unit) follow. by charge plan BRP (Better Route Proposal) 

**Precondition:** Route planned to Pastoor Max Leessensstraat 8, Elsloo; BE8, DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance) semi-dynamic, Alternatives on, EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) on (20% SoC at dest), EV (Electric Vehicle) mocked through OBD2.

**Observation:** At 22:02, a BRP (Better Route Proposal) is received because the destination cannot be reached with the current charging plan (arrival at 17% while target SoC is 20%). The BRP remains in the RM (Route Monitor) until the decision point. After passing the decision point without selecting the BRP, an EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) PU (Product Unit) indicates that the destination cannot be reached with the current charge planning, and no alternative is available, immediately followed by another BRP.

**Expectation:** EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) PU (Product Unit)'s should only be shown when there really is no other option.

**Healing:** Ignore all BRP (Better Route Proposal)'s and EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) PU (Product Unit)'s until reaching the destination. Alternatively, the user could disable the EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) and/or decrease the destination SoC target.

description_match_results.description:
[Title]
 Unrealistic ETA and SoC on LDEV 

[CONFIGURATION]
Audi e-tron 55 Technology Carrier - IN-MC-431E
VR: VR40
Gateway SW (HCP5): HW: X14 SW: D260
ConMod SW: HW: 006 SW: X658
Head Unit SW: VR40_A13E_HCP3_AU_MRM_20240925_01_S651
VIN: BAUNEEGFZ21052708
Navigation APK: TT_fastfeedback_SDK_2024.48.3-dev
Resource Provider APK: built-in from platform
NAV DB: CariadMap_EUR_0300_24122_PR108.0
?
[SUMMARY]
[TomTom] Unrealistic ETA and SoC on LDEV
- Unrealistic ETA
- Arrival SoC not updating
- Route not updating to a more optimal path after multiple deviations

[PRECONDITION]


Route planned from Porsche Hemmingen (48.8677496780386, 9.041403853175364) to TomTom Eindhoven with as stop-over:
- Flughafen Stuttgart (visited)
- Pastoor Max Leessensstraat 8, Elsloo

BE8, DRG automatic, Alternatives off, EVTP on (default), EV mocked through OBD2

[ACTION]
Follow the guidance, observe ETA

[OBSERVATION]
The initial route was planned at 13:30.

At ~14:29, we reach the stop-over Flughafen Stuttgart. After this, we observe that the ETA for the next stop-over is very unrealistic: it is showing an ETA of ~22:36. A more realistic ETA at that time is ~20:32.

We continue to follow the route. At 15:00, the ETA has increased to 23:44 at the next stop-over.
Image: 1500ETA.jpg
Image: 1500ChargePlan.jpg

According to this, the route between the first and second charging stop would take almost 5 hours while covering 167km on the highway/autobahn. This is of-course completely unrealistic.

The issue remains apparent until at least 15:45, where the ETA increased up to 02:09 at the stop and 03:03. While doing so, we also deviated from the route (to drive Stuttgart - Karlsruhe - Mannheim instead of the suggested Stuttgart - Heilbronn - Mannheim), and we noticed that the arrival SoC at the CS in the route plan didn't change. At 15:45, our SoC was ~50% (46.25kWh), traveling 163km to the charger would make it impossible to arrive with 27% SoC.

Additionally, the routing didn't calculate a different alternative and kept routing us back to Stuttgart to take the Heilbronn - Mannheim route.
Image: 1545ChargePlan.jpg

Route goes over Karlsruhe after many deviations at 15:57, with a much faster ETA at the first CS. The travel time between the first and second CS is still faulty.
Image: 1557ChargePlan.jpg

From 16:32 - 17:02, we charge at a CS earlier than suggested in the route planning. After leaving the CS. The route does not immediately get updated with the current SoC: the arrival SoC at the next CS in 27km is still set to 27% even tough we charged up to 80%. At 17:08, the new SoC suddenly gets in to the route. From this point onward, the ETA also drops massively. Before the update the ETA was 3:31 at the first stop. After the update, the ETA was 20:57 (= 6hr34 faster). 

[EXPECTATION]
ETA should always be realistic
Arrival SoC should be updating when the charge or route changes
Route should be updating to a more optimal path after multiple deviations.

[HEALING]
At 17:08, the new SoC suddenly gets in to the route. From this point onward, the ETA also drops massively. Before the update the ETA was 3:31 at the first stop. After the update, the ETA was 20:57 (= 6hr34 faster). 

[TIMESTAMP]
14:29 - 17:08

[NOTE]
Logs for the relevant 2.5 hrs have been added to the ticket.

Full logs can be found at https://etf.esolutions.de/user/?etf_id=6174568

The relevant parts on ETF are Part 1 and Part 2:
Part 1: https://etf.esolutions.de/user/?etf_id=6174585 (13:27 - 16:33)
Part 2: https://etf.esolutions.de/user/?etf_id=6174582 (16:53 - 17:15)

[CONTACT]
matthijs.koot@tomtom.com
manjunath.kubasad@tomtom.com
ttdrivetesting
description_match_results.processed_description:
### Issue Description
**Title:** Unrealistic ETA (Estimated Time of Arrival) and SoC on LDEV

**Precondition:**  
Route planned from Porsche Hemmingen to TomTom Eindhoven with stop-overs at Flughafen Stuttgart and Pastoor Max Leessensstraat 8, Elsloo. BE8, DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance) automatic, Alternatives off, EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) on (default), EV (Electric Vehicle) mocked through OBD2.

**Observation:**  
The initial route was planned at 13:30. At ~14:29, the ETA for the next stop-over was showing ~22:36, while a more realistic ETA was ~20:32. By 15:00, the ETA increased to 23:44. The route between the first and second charging stop was unrealistic, taking almost 5 hours for 167km. The arrival SoC at the charging station did not change despite deviations from the route. At 15:45, the SoC was ~50%, making it impossible to arrive with 27% SoC. The routing did not calculate alternatives and kept directing back to Stuttgart. After charging at a CS (Charging Station) from 16:32 - 17:02, the route did not update the current SoC until 17:08, after which the ETA dropped significantly.

**Expectation:**  
ETA should always be realistic. Arrival SoC should update when the charge or route changes. The route should update to a more optimal path after multiple deviations.

**Healing:**  
At 17:08, the new SoC was incorporated into the route, resulting in a significant drop in ETA from 3:31 to 20:57 (6hr34 faster).

[Title]
Back online causes route update w/DRG=semi 

[CONFIGURATION]
ttdrivetesting

Audi e-tron 55 Technology Carrier - IN-MC-431E
VR: VR 35
Gateway SW (HCP5): HW: X14 SW: D260
ConMod SW: HW: C2.3 SW: X658
Head Unit SW: VR40_A13E_HCP3_AU_MRM_20240925_01_S651
VIN: BAUNEEGFZ21052708
Navigation APK:  TT_fastfeedback_SDK_2024.41.1-dev
Resource Provider APK: built-in from platform
NAV DB: CariadMap_EUR_0200_23122_PR047.0, OTA enabled

[SUMMARY]
Automatic route update with DRG=semi when switching from offline to online.

[PRECONDITION]
Time: 14:41 CEST
Driving on A2 near Ittervoort. Current location: 51.16733411537928, 5.877255269606253

System OFFLINE (Privacy Vehicle Switch OFF)
DRG = semi-dynamic
SoC very low ~4-5%

Route to Paris, on which we have skipped CS a few times. We have gotten some EVTP Popups for unreachable destination (which is OK), but ignored them so EVTP planner is still active. Currently the route has a CS that has 0% SoC upon arrival. See 1447_onboardLDEV_deviateUntilZeroArrivalSocAtCS.png:

[ACTION]
Turn Privacy Vehicle Switch to ON to go back to online state.

[OBSERVATION]
Since we are now online, we get a BRP immediately that shows a pop-up for a route that is reachable but with +1h37min travel time, including a 22kW charger. This is OK. But while inspection the route itself, the alternative route screen appeared showing the reachable alternative and the original route. At some point, the original route vanished and the alternative route moved to the top of the list. When closing the screen, it looked like the new route had been activated automatically.

See video: 1448_DRGoff_RouteUpdatedAutomatically.mp4

[EXPECTATION]
With DRG = semi-dynamic, we do not expect the route to get updated automatically.

[HEALING]
We end up with a route that has a reachable charge station, so in terms of reachability this is not a bad outcome per se, but the 'manual selection' aspect of the semi-dynamic DRG setting was violated.

[ATTACHMENTS]
Full logs here: https://etf.esolutions.de/user/?etf_id=5978401
Cut traces:
automaticRouteUpdateDRGsemi.esotrace

[CONTACT]
pepijn.michels@tomtom.com
frank.spierings@tomtom.com
description_match_results.processed_description:
### Issue Description
**Title:** Back online causes route update w/DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance)=semi  

**Precondition:**  
- Time: 14:41 CEST  
- Driving on A2 near Ittervoort. Current location: 51.16733411537928, 5.877255269606253  
- System OFFLINE (Privacy Vehicle Switch OFF)  
- DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance) = semi-dynamic  
- SoC very low ~4-5%  
- Route to Paris, with skipped CS (Charging Station) and EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) popups for unreachable destination.  

**Observation:**  
Upon going online, a BRP (Better Route Proposal) appeared showing a reachable route with +1h37min travel time, including a 22kW charger. The original route vanished and the alternative route moved to the top of the list, leading to the new route being activated automatically.  

**Expectation:**  
With DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance) = semi-dynamic, we do not expect the route to get updated automatically.  

**Healing:**  
The outcome resulted in a route with a reachable charging station, but the 'manual selection' aspect of the semi-dynamic DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance) setting was violated.

input.jira_analysis_finding: The system behaves as expected and user gets a reachable route. During the initial planning and just after it there were several deviations that led to the B2R route calculation. This route might not be reachable, which is why just after it an immediate route update is performed. After that immediate route update - a route is reachable. It does not depend on the connectivity, an issue here was in a deviation which triggered a new calculation of a route. We do not guarantee reachability for a B2R route.

### Issue Description
**Title:** tomtomOnboard route shortly unreachable after go o

**Precondition:** Current location: 51.48655530958773, 5.390155298220734; BE8 (but OFFLINE since we turned Privacy Switch OFF), DRG (Dynamic Route Guidance) semi-dynamic, Alternatives on, EVTP (Electrical Vehicle Trip Planner) on, EV (Electric Vehicle) mocked through OBD2.

**Observation:** Online services are re-established, and about 1 minute after toggling ON the Privacy Vehicle Switch, the ETA (Estimated Time of Arrival) gets updated such that arrival SoC becomes -60% instead of 10% and ETA drops. It looks like it falls back for a bit to the onboard calculated combustion route.

**Expectation:** When online connection restores, the onboard planned EV (Electric Vehicle) route does not shortly revert back to an unreachable route that needs a BRP (Better Route Proposal) warning for "unreachability"; this is misleading. Onboard route plan was OK to begin with.

**Healing:** BRP (Better Route Proposal) shows up to activate the online planned better route. This route has ETA (Estimated Time of Arrival) of 21:59 and 434km distance.
